conclusion: Determine the power P2 of lamp L2 when the conductor rod ab moves to the right at a constant speed.
Lamp L1 lights up normally, meaning the voltage across L1 is 3V.
Calculate current I1 through L1 using P1 = 3W and V1 = 3V: I1 = P1/V1 = 1A.
Current in the circuit is the same, so I = 1A.
Emf induced in the circuit is given by Faraday's law: emf = B * l * v.
Calculate resistance of L1: R1 = V1^2/P1 = 3Ω.
Calculate resistance of L2: R2 = V2^2/P2 = 6Ω.
Calculate total resistance: R_total = r + R1 + R2 = 10Ω.
Calculate speed v using I = emf/R_total: v = 50/3 m/s.
Calculate voltage across L2: V2 = emf - V1 = 7V.
Calculate power in L2: P2 = V2^2/R2 = 49/6 W.
Final answer for power P2 is 49/6 W.
